subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Fw: Test message
msgSnippet: ... Hi Moira, I cannot display your message in my email, even though I have Thoth Unicode installed. If I change the encoding back to plain old Thoth, it looks
messageBody:
Moira wrote:
>
>
> ﻿
>
> This is a test message using Anthony Grahn's Text Entry tool, composed
> in Windows Mail:
>
>       . '   ,   
> .           .
>
> .
>

Hi Moira,

I cannot display your message in my email, even though I have Thoth
Unicode installed. If I change the encoding back to plain old Thoth, it
looks like this:

Hs z A test mesiJ jMzN .Antoni gryn'z tekst entri tMl, lompOzd in windMz
mFl. E wont t sI hQ i z displFd in vEriaz mIda.

.mqra

You can cut and paste this in a Word document and see how it appears.
You can see that the first letter is "composed" is Loll rather than
Kick. That means 2 things: First, that my emailer won't display Unicode,
and second, some of the letters are wrong.

Paul

Hi Moira,

I cannot display your message in my email, even though I have Thoth 
Unicode installed. If I change the encoding back to plain old Thoth, it 
looks like this:

Hs z A test mesiJ jMzN .Antoni gryn'z tekst entri tMl, lompOzd in windMz 
mFl.  E wont t sI hQ i z displFd in vEriaz mIda.

.mqra

You can cut and paste this in a Word document and see how it appears. 
You can see that the first letter is "composed" is Loll rather than 
Kick. That means 2 things: First, that my emailer won't display Unicode, 
and second, some of the letters are wrong.

Paul
